title: Scenario 1: Publicly Exposed Management Interface
question: A cloud-based application exposes its management console directly to the internet with only single-factor authentication. What are the architectural flaws and what security questions should be raised during review?
answer: The management interface should not be internet-facing and must be protected with strong authentication, network segmentation, and access controls. Questions should focus on admin access paths, MFA, logging, and isolation from production workloads.

title: Scenario 2: Flat Network Architecture
question: All application tiers (web, app, database) are deployed in the same network segment with unrestricted east-west traffic. What risks does this create?
answer: This enables lateral movement in case of compromise. Review should question network segmentation, zero-trust principles, and micro-segmentation controls.
